steps.title: Find the Living Room Box
steps.description: Locate the box labeled "Living Room". It contains the Nano Meter, Remote, and Power Sensor.

steps.title: Place the Nano Meter
steps.description: Position the Nano Meter next to your TV. It needs to "hear" the audio clearly.
steps.tip: Make sure it is not blocked by soundbars or decorations.

steps.title: Connect Power Sensor
steps.description: Plug your TV power cord into the Nielsen Power Sensor, then plug the Sensor into the wall.
steps.tip: This helps us know exactly when the TV is on or off.

steps.title: Place the Remote
steps.description: Set the People Meter Remote near the Nano Meter for easy access.

steps.title: Find a Central Spot
steps.description: Choose a location central to all your TVs where you get good cell signal.
steps.tip: Avoid placing it in a cabinet or behind furniture.

steps.title: Plug it In
steps.description: Connect the Hub to a power outlet. Look for the blinking lights indicating it has power.
steps.tip: Do not use an outlet controlled by a light switch.

steps.title: Next to Router
steps.description: Place the Streaming Meter next to your home WiFi router.

steps.title: Connect Ethernet
steps.description: Plug the attached ethernet cable into any open port on your router.

steps.title: Power Up
steps.description: Plug the power adapter into a wall outlet. Green lights will flash when ready.

steps.title: Setup Nano Meter
steps.description: Just like the living room, place the Nano Meter near the TV.
